title: What Doomed a Sprawling City Near St. Louis 1,000 Years Ago?

title_detail.value: What Doomed a Sprawling City Near St. Louis 1,000 Years Ago?

summary: Excavations at Cahokia, famous for its pre-Columbian mounds, challenge the idea that residents destroyed the city through wood clearing.

summary_detail.value: Excavations at Cahokia, famous for its pre-Columbian mounds, challenge the idea that residents destroyed the city through wood clearing.

author: Asher Elbein

media_credit.content: Whitney Curtis for The New York Times
